chapter.title: Tools
chapter.para: This section describes various tools for testing several connections (both local and remote) of printers.

section.title: Purpose
section.para: Test if it is possible to send data to a local port. This usually results in a page with a text printed.

section.title: Command line
section.para: $1 is the message to sent to the port. $2 is the device node to send the data to. $3 is the time limit to perform the operation.

section.title: Exit code
section.para: 0 means that there was no problem. 1 means that the operation timed out. 2 means that there was a problem writing to the device.

section.title: Purpose
section.para: Test is it is possible to send data to a remote IPP queue. It shouldn't lead to any data printed.

section.title: Command line
section.para: $1 is the name of the remote host. $2 is the name of the remote queue. $3 is the time limit to perform the operation.

section.title: Exit code
section.para: 0 means that there was no problem. 1 means that the host or queue name was not set. 2 means that the remote host is unreachable. 3 means that it was not possible to connect. to the port 631 of the remote host. 4 means that the queue does not accept the job (either does not exist or queuing is disabled).

section.title: purpose
section.para: Test if it is possible to send data to a remote LPD queue. It shouldn't leat to any data printed.

section.title: Command line
section.para: $1 is the name of the remote host. $2 is the name of the remote queue. $3 is the time limit to perform the operation.

section.title: Exit code
section.para: 0 means that there was no problem. 1 means that the host or queue name was not set. 2 means that the remote host is unreachable. 3 means that it was not possible to connect. to the port 515 of the remote host. 4 means that the queue does not accept the job (either does not exist or queuing is disabled).

section.title: Purpose
section.para: Test if it is possible to send data to remote SMB queue. It should not lead to any data printed.

section.title: Command line
section.para: $1 is the name of the workgroup. $2 is the name of the remote host. $3 is the name of the remote queue. $4 is the user name to authenticate against the server. $5 is the password to use to authenticate. $6 is the time limit to perform the operation.

section.title: Exit code
section.para: 0 means that there was no problem. 1 means that the host or queue name was not set. 2 means that the remote host is unreachable. 4 means that the queue does not accept the job (either does not exist or queuing is disabled).

section.title: test_remote_novell
section.section: Purpose Test if it is possible to send data to remote Novell Netware queue. It should not lead to any data printed.

section.title: Command line
section.para: $1 is the name of the remote host. $2 is the name of the remote queue. $3 is the user name to authenticate against the server. $4 is the password to use to authenticate. $5 is the time limit to perform the operation.

section.title: Exit code
section.para: 0 means that there was no problem. 1 means that the host or queue name was not set. 4 means that the queue does not accept the job (either does not exist or queuing is disabled).

section.title: Purpose
section.para: Test it if is possible to send data to a TCP port of a remote host. It should not lead to any data printed.

section.title: Command line
section.para: $1 is the name of the remote host. $2 is the port number of the TCP port. $3 is the time limit to perform the operation.

section.title: Exit code
section.para: 0 means that there was no problem.. 1 means that the host name was not set. 2 means that the remote host is unreachable. 3 means that it was not possible to connect. to the specified port of the remote host. 4 means that the the port on the remote host doesn't accept data.
